intro: Delpinoa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Delpinoa is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
